title: COMMENT | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Adds a comment or overwrites an existing comment for an existing object.

Comments can be added to all objects (users, roles, warehouses, databases, tables, etc.). You can use this command to add comments
to individual table columns, but not to constraints on columns.
You can also add comments when you are creating or altering objects:
Specify the COMMENT parameter in the CREATE <object> or ALTER <object> command.
The COMMENT parameter can also be used in the ALTER <object> command to change an existing comment at any time.
A slightly different syntax is used for adding comments to table columns:
A comment can be added at creation by following the column declaration with the COMMENT keyword (not property).
The comment can then be changed using this command.
To add a comment to a constraint, use the CREATE TABLE or CREATE | ALTER TABLE … CONSTRAINT commands.

The DESCRIBE TABLE output does not show comments for table constraints, such as multi-column primary keys. To see these comments,
query the TABLE_CONSTRAINTS view.

Customers should ensure that no personal data (other than for a User object), sensitive data, export-controlled data, or other regulated data is entered as metadata when using the Snowflake service. For more information, see Metadata fields in Snowflake.
